Responsibilities: Improved the functionality of an interactive accessibility map

Designed and implemented a robust backend system using Python
Built secure and scalable RESTful APIs with Flask/FastAPI
Focused on user privacy and data security by integrating encryption protocols and adaptive learning
Enhanced the LightGBM algorithm with custom loss functions and feature engineering
Developed robust preprocessing methods to clean and manage a sample dataset
Designed and fine-tuned an ensemble forecasting system combining SARIMA, LightGBM, and Transformers
Researching and planning backend architecture for a Dynamic Course Recommender app
Investigating machine learning libraries such as sci-kit-learn and TensorFlow to develop personalized course recommendation algorithms
Evaluating web scraping tools like BeautifulSoup and natural language processing libraries for gathering and analyzing course information
Planned and designed an intuitive interface using vanilla JavaScript
Implemented features and interactions to elevate the overall user experience
Led a team of 200 in a startup initiative involving 1000 people during the second wave of COVID-19 in India
Coordinated efforts with contractors to secure oxygen cylinders and essential supplies

questions.question: During your time at PwC, you enhanced the LightGBM algorithm. Imagine you discovered a significant improvement in model performance during testing, but it relied on a complex and difficult-to-explain technique.  How would you approach presenting this to your team and stakeholders?
options: Present the improvement and the complex technique as is, emphasizing the performance gains and offering to deep-dive into the technical details upon request.
Simplify the explanation of the technique, potentially omitting some details, to make it more accessible to a broader audience, focusing on the positive results.
Hold off on presenting the findings until you can develop a simpler, more easily understandable approach that achieves similar performance gains.
Present the improvement and acknowledge the complexity of the technique, recommending further investigation and collaboration to validate and simplify it.

questions.question: While working on Resumagic, you integrated AWS Lambda for secure Gemini API interactions.  If you faced unexpected latency issues with Lambda affecting the user experience, what steps would you take to diagnose and resolve the problem?
options: Immediately roll back the Lambda integration to a previous stable version and investigate the issue offline.
Implement detailed logging and monitoring within the Lambda function to pinpoint the source of the latency.
Consult AWS documentation and online forums for similar reported issues and try suggested solutions.
Reach out to AWS support for immediate assistance while simultaneously investigating the issue internally.

questions.question: Reflecting on your experience leading a team at ParmarthNGO during the COVID-19 crisis, describe a time you had to make a critical decision with limited information and resources. What was the situation, and how did you approach making that decision?
options: Gather all available information quickly, even if incomplete, consult with the team on potential solutions, and choose the option with the highest potential benefit, accepting the inherent risks.
Prioritize the most urgent needs, focusing on immediate impact and delegating tasks to team members with relevant expertise, adjusting the plan as more information becomes available.
Seek guidance from experienced individuals outside the immediate team who might have encountered similar challenges, leveraging their knowledge to inform the decision-making process.

Focus on maintaining open communication and transparency with the team and stakeholders about the limited resources and evolving situation, making collaborative decisions based on the best available data.
